After a considerable amount of research, I found out that this is the UK 1.2 version.  Yes, the properties say 1.1 but that is a programmer error.

The second disk image is NOT corrupt.  Using Daemon Tools Lite, you need to mount the first CD image, start the install, unmount CD1 when the installer asks for CD2, click "ignore" when DT Lite complains, mount CD2, then continue the install.

This version does not ask for a CD key at any point.

When you're done installing, do NOT run X2.exe yet or it will install Starforce!  If you did anyway, to get rid of Starforce, google for "sfcdrvrem.zip".

Get the UK 1.4 patch, the No Copy Protection 1.4 patch, and the 1.5 patch from here and install them:
http://www.egosoft.com/download/x2/patches_en.php
The No Copy Protection 1.4 patch removes the Starforce DRM.

Clarification of the above: when you mount CD2, it needs to be in the same path as CD1 was.  That is, if you mounted CD1 on E:, then CD2 needs to be mounted on E:.  If you mount both CDs at once, one on E: and the other on F:, then you will get the corruption warning because the installer is trying to pull CD2 files from CD1.
